str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To carry, wear, bear constantly. From phoros; to have a burden, i.e. to wear as clothing or a constant accompaniment.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A crown, garland, honor, glory. From an apparently primary stepho; a chaplet, literally or figuratively.
Made of thorns. From akantha; thorny.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Purple. From porphura; purpureal, i.e. Bluish red.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
